snippet: The 1962 A.F.L. championship game, won by Dallas in double overtime, helped establish the upstart league.
abstract: Box Seats article by John Eisenberg recalls the 1962 American Football League championship game between the Dallas Texans and Houston Oilers; contends that the game, won by Dallas in double overtime, was just as vital to the process of propelling the NFL into decades of growth as Indianapolis Colts-New York Giants NFL overtime game in 1958.
lead_paragraph: The 1962 A.F.L. championship game, won by Dallas in double overtime, helped establish the upstart league.

headline.seo: In 1962, Championship Spectacle Put the A.F.L. in the Game
headline.main: A Football Interloper’s First Gust of Success
headline.print_headline: A Football Interloper’s First Gust Of Success
